chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Nicholas R. Ronzani was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge within the term of probation.  Defendant to pay costs of supervision.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
Defendant must attend and comply with the terms of alcohol court. Probation Review Hearing set 9/5/14 at 2:00 p.m. in Br. 1.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

records.addlTxt: Probation Intake Order
Probation review hearing on September 5, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas R. Ronzani in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Court reviewed CPR and PQWOR, heard the stipulation of the parties to the facts in the Crim. Complaint/Information, found sufficient facts, heard plea of Guilty to Count 1of the Information-OWI-4th, and did find his plea was given FKVI.  The Court accepted that plea and found Defendant guilty of OWI-4th.  Upon that plea, Count 2 wass dismissed and Count 3 was dismissed and read-in.  BAC was .168%.  The Court heard from State, Defense and Defendant, and sentenced him as follows:  S/W, 3 years of probation with conditions:  360 days in the DCJail with H/T, consecutive to his sentence in 12CF58 (due to be completed on 10-6-2014 for Fond du Lac County Case No. 12CF58); $600 fine plus costs, driver improvement surcharge, blood draw fee to BD Comm. Hospital, participate in alcohol Court comm. 9-5-2014 at 2:00 PM, AODA and followthru, absolute sobriety, no bars, beer tents, etc., no operating a m/v w/out valid driver's license, VIP w/in 120 days, and revocation of driver's license for 36 months as well as a IIL for 36 months.  The Court found there is no presentence credit at this time, but will allow defendant 30 days to provide information should he believe that to be incorrect.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.
